intro: Myrsine cavaleriei, commonly known as the Guangxi myrsine, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. It produces small white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are attractive to birds. Myrsine cavaleriei is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
